top_categories.workout_context: Oregon Trail Gravel Grinder’s 375-mile distance demands power production deep into fatigue — the defining challenge of ultra-distance gravel.

Oregon Trail Gravel Grinder’s high desert and forest service gravel across central oregon and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Racing Oregon Trail Gravel Grinder isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Oregon Trail Gravel Grinder’s high desert gravel, forest service roads demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Every session at Oregon Trail Gravel Grinder intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Oregon Trail Gravel Grinder when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Oregon Trail Gravel Grinder’s 35,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Oregon Trail Gravel Grinder rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
At 375 miles, Oregon Trail Gravel Grinder rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Oregon Trail Gravel Grinder’s high desert and forest service gravel across central oregon delivers on race day.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Oregon Trail Gravel Grinder. Make this intensity feel like home.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Oregon Trail Gravel Grinder — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 375 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 375 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.altitude: Oregon Trail Gravel Grinder with 35,000ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%. High-altitude sun exposure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Oregon Trail Gravel Grinder requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on high desert and forest service gravel across central oregon to build confidence. Expect: high desert gravel, forest service roads, mountain passes.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, VO2max, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 375 miles of high desert and forest service gravel across central oregon in Central Oregon (multiple towns).
